title: Project Coordinator
description:
Overview:

At NV5, we are a team of talented professionals, engineers, and consultants who are builders, problem solvers, and champions for both our communities and clients. Our mission is to empower every employee who strives to make a lasting, positive impact for the future of our communities.  

Join us and take charge of your career, creating your own growth while building a sustainable legacy for generations to come. As part of our team, you'll discover limitless opportunities to make meaningful contributions while advancing professionally. You'll work with diverse and talented group of individuals committed to making a positive impact on the communities in which we live and work.  

If you consider yourself a multitasker & problem solver aiming to grow your career within Office Administration/Analyst field, then our Project Coordinator opportunity will provide you with a fulfilling position allowing you to work with leadership and project teams to support NV5’s Owner's Representative group. **THE OPPORTUNITY**
NV5 is seeking a Project Coordinator to support a group of Project Mangers within the company. This person will also support the Leadership Team on various public and private projects. The Project Coordinator acts as main office contact and ambassador for the company. This position is typically located our Denver office but location may be flexible.
Responsibilities:
**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING*** Act as the office manager and main office contact, which includes general office organization, supply procurement and may include local travel.
* Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, clients, and vendors.
* Create and maintain master contact list for each project as projects commence and team members are added.
* Develop and distribute meeting minutes or records as needed on assigned projects.
* Review and evaluate monthly project draw package documentation (e.g., budgets, AIA standard pay applications/documentation, invoices, lien waivers, bills of sale, certificates of insurance, etc.).
* Collect, review and document consultant, contractor, and vendor invoices on each project. Initiate process for corrections when needed; prepare monthly draw requests and process invoices.
* Obtain project specific information from Project Manager in order to prepare consultant agreements, from NV5 Standard Templates, including collection of project specific insurance certificates, bonds and other contract exhibits.
* Collect, review and catalog all project close out documents as required by projects.
* Maintain cloud-based records and document storage for each project utilizing NV5’s proprietary naming conventions. Ensure documents are uploaded and saved in a timely manner and ensure accurate file maintenance.
* Assist with completing document templates including developing written narratives, editing text and proof reading to support project tasks.
* Be available and in office during business hours.


Qualifications:
**WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO OUR COMPANY*** Bachelor's degree in Business, Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, Data Analysis preferred. Preference given to alternate education on a case-by-case basis.
* Financial acumen,

***The successful candidate:**** Is able to multitask and easily transition between micro and macro tasks on multiple projects.
* Presents themselves in a polished and friendly manner at all times.
* Demonstrates knowledge of process implementation and process improvement and applies appropriate strategies/techniques to accomplish desired outcomes.
* Possess financial acumen with previous experience in analyzing invoices, resolving discrepancies and end to end understanding of financial project management.
* Demonstrates effective communication/customer service within team and with clients, agencies, and managers involved with projects.
* Employs exceptional and responsive written and verbal communication skills
* Utilizes exceptional organizational skills in simultaneously completing multiple tasks and multiple projects.
* Has strong analytical, tactical, and problem-solving skills.
* Demonstrates sound judgment and personal integrity.
* Works independently while in a team environment.
* Seeks clarification and requests supplemental instruction in order to complete tasks in a timely manner.
* Has a positive and professional attitude.
* Handles high levels of stress well, especially regarding deadlines.
* Actively seeks to improve skills and skill sets, participates in continuing education.
* Is proficient in Microsoft Office programs including Word, Excel, Power Point, Teams and Outlook .
* Technical writing skills and experience are a plus.

  

The pay range for this position in Colorado is $28.85- $38.47 per hour; however, base pay offered may be higher or lower depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience of the candidate. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via the NV5 careers site. This role will remain open and accepting applications on our website until filled, or for at least 5 months since posting date.  

NV5 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, PTO, 401(k) and professional development/advancement opportunities.

 *NV5 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. NV5 complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

title: Project Manger 4
description:
At xpertBizz we take pride in providing excellent result-driven IT solutions and services. We are an expert technology solution and services provider with proven track record of more than 20 years in Information Technology industry. We work hard to align technical solutions and suggestions to achieve the business goals.


Job Description:


Information Security Office is seeking a senior IT Technical Project Manager to manage and deliver complex IT project(s) with multiple teams and work streams coordinated to an aggressive delivery schedule.


The project manager is responsible for the outcome of the assigned projects. The project manager leads the team through the Commonwealth Standard for Project Management for successful completion of the project phases: Preselect, Initiation, Planning, Execution, Monitoring and Closeout.


Qualifications:

* Candidate MUST have PMP certification through PMI or PM certification from Virginia Information Technologies Agency (VITA).
* Candidate must also be able to work onsite 3-4 days/week
* A minimum of 7 years of project experience in IT infrastructure delivery, network and server infrastructure, knowledge of Cloud implementations, and vendor management.
* Familiarity with network technologies (switches, firewalls, circuits, etc.) standards and practices.
* Manage projects consisting of Software as a Service (SaaS) and/or IT Infrastructure components (Servers, storage, OS upgrades, networking, software installs, vulnerability remediation, etc.)
* Experience managing large multi-stream projects
* Experience in various software development methodologies. Preferred experience with Agile.
* This position requires a fingerprint-based background check.


Required Skill Matrix:


Candidate MUST have PMP certification through PMI or PM certification from Virginia Information Technologies Agency (VITA)-7 years


Preferred experience with Agile-7 years


A minimum of 7 years of project experience in IT Infrastructure, Identity Access Management, Risk Management, SIEM, Software as a Service (SaaS)-7 years


Experience managing large multi-stream and complex projects for successful completion of all project phases-7 years

title: Senior Director of Exterior Systems
description:
The Senior Director – Exteriors Systems, under the direction the Sr. Vice President, is expected to deliver major technical and financial contributions that will lead to a significant number of commercial successes for the AZEK Exteriors product line and continue our industry leadership for this category. The individual will lead and manage a Research team, and create long-term sustainable advantage for the company utilizing our Stage Gate system to successfully lead product development and cost reduction projects from ideation, through development, validation, and to launch. The individual will have an in depth knowledge of product and process development and champion processes to maximize launch success. The incumbent is recognized by other functional mangers as a key contributor. The incumbent will display a commitment to Core Values.

**NOTE: This position is based in the Greater Cincinnati, Ohio area. Relocation assistance will be provided if needed.**

* Works on problems of diverse scope across a range of technical and business areas.
* Works on complex goals that require effort to define and organize. Responsible for defining and leading the project to deliver the solution.
* Develop, align, and execute technology roadmap/plan delivering cost and performance leadership in our category, drive high levels of recycle polymer usage while maintaining targeted cost/performance, deliver sustained value through formula, process, and system innovations.
* Effective business acumen. Translates business needs to R&D projects and staff effectively. Can communicate the impact of R&D projects and tools effectively to peers in other functional areas.
* Required to network, internally and externally, to acquire information for projects and identify future opportunities.
* Develop project schedules, incorporating key tactical items for other functional areas.
* Effectively lead and mentor the scientific and technical staff.
* Required to effectively present complex or conflicting information.
* Required to adapt to the audience and present technical information to a non-technical audience.
* May personally lead complex or critical projects personally. Form strong relationships with peers in other functional area to align and manage resources, schedule, and deliverables for projects.
* Ensure projects have clear FFU. Understand the competitive environment and create sustained competitive advantage for the company.

**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:**  
Education: Minimum of 10 years technical experience and an MS or PhD in a physical science. Minimum of 5 years technical leadership experience.

**Other desired skills:**

* Track record of commercially successful projects.
* Program and Project Management experience.
* Strong background in manufacturing systems, data collection and statistical analysis.
* Demonstrated cross functional team leadership.
* Strong communication skills: verbal and written
* Expertise with Product Development and Innovation tools.

**Skills**

Candidates should be data driven decision makers. This role will work across AZEK sites as required by the project. The candidate will need to become expert in our current manufacturing processes and lead the Stage Gate process for their area.

Candidate soft skills: Collaboration at all levels of the organization, presentation of technical concepts to technical and non-technical partners, business acumen.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several geographic markets. The annual salary for this position ranges from $160,080 in our lowest market up to $207,920 in our highest market, plus bonus, equity, and benefits as applicable. The pay for roles at AZEK varies depending on a wide range of factors including but not limited to the specific work location, role, skill set, and level of experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $160,080.00 - $207,920.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Relocation assistance
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* RSU

Experience level:

* 10 years

Education:

* Master's (Required)

Experience:

* related: 10 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Cincinnati, OH: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Marketing Manger
description:
**Position Summary/Objective:**

The Marketing Manager is responsible for innovation/renovation marketing strategies and leads all commercial activation for Kappler’s product portfolio. The Marketing Manager builds and analyzes customer insights, translating these to actions that bring value to our customers and commercial activations that drive sustainable, profitable growth. The Marketing Manager will have a strategic mindset with the ability to work closely with Marketing, Sales, Customer Service, and Technical Support & Training management.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Builds and leverages external market and internal insights to inform product innovation/renovation and develop effective branding and messaging to create and capture customer value.
* Leads marketing initiatives (Innovation/Renovation/ Life Cycle Maximization / Product Changes) in support of driving profitable sustainable revenue growth.
* Builds commercial value proposition for customers (end-user, chooser, distribution, and sales).
* Activates market specific commercial sales and marketing plans, including trade show activation, to realize profitable revenue.
* Leads the development and execution of detailed product commercialization plans, within the BFx framework, for all product renovation and innovation programs.
* Partners with internal and external teams to guide development and management of digital sales tools (CRM), websites, SEO management, etc.
* Monitors performance of marketing programs (ROI) and provides recommendations for improvement.
* Manages any assigned marketing budget.
* Actively visits customers and channel partners to capture insights and check and adjust marketing programs.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of company objectives and support activities.
* Work closely with Growth Strategy Director and marketing team to meet operational strategic goals.
* Work onsite, in person to develop cross-departmental relationships and collaboration, maintain high levels of service and productivity, and be readily available to promptly address dynamic business needs as they arise.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to create and maintain positive working relationships.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality.
* Ability to manage and direct projects including trade show planning and activation.
* Ability to work autonomously and stay focused in a high-stress, fast-paced environment.
* Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Thorough understanding of company products and logistics.
* Proficient/Experience with MRP, ERP, and CRM systems.
* Basic math skills including an advanced understanding of units of measure, fractions, and decimals.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.

**Education & Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field strongly preferred.
* Five to ten years of experience in marketing and/or brand management with a demonstrated track record of achievement and growth in leadership behavior strongly preferred.
* At least one year of experience as a supervisor, manager, or similar relevant position strongly preferred.
* Marketing Commercialization and/or P&L Management experience strongly preferred.
* Experience resolving complex problems and translating to business opportunities strongly preferred.
* Proven ability to successfully collaborate and drive results across cross functional teams – sales, product development, manufacturing, etc., strongly preferred.
* Proven success managing and successfully influencing complex stakeholder relationships strongly preferred.
* Experience working in B2B environment preferred.
* Voice of customer tactical experience preferred.
* Customer experience mapping preferred.
* Experience managing projects through gate processes and managing products and portfolios preferred.

**Work Environment & Physical Demands:**

* To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform job functions.
* Must be able to stand, sit, and walk for prolonged periods of time; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate computer and telephone keyboards.
* Noise levels are usually moderate.
* Ability to see and adjust, close vision and distance vision.
* Occasional travel required.
* Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at a time.

**Compensation:**

Salary and benefits will be competitive and commensurate with experience.

**About Kappler:**

For more than 45 years Kappler has defined the protective clothing industry with patented fabrics, innovative seaming technology and unique garment designs. All of our critical protection chemical and biohazard suits are produced at our corporate headquarters in Guntersville, Alabama, providing American-made quality for added assurance. Registered to ISO 9001 since 1996, we document every detail when it comes to ensuring product quality. End-user safety is priority one, and our integrated manufacturing process is geared to making sure every garment meets demanding specifications. Whether it’s designing the most user-friendly suit possible or pressure-testing every gas-tight suit before it leaves the factory, Kappler quality comes through every time. From Berry-compliant products for DoD markets to NFPA-certified apparel for the most challenging hazmat calls, you know what you’re getting into with Kappler.

**How to Apply:** 

Apply online at https://www.kappler.com/about/careers

Or email your resume and cover letter hr@kappler.com

title: Project Development Manger
description:
Select Milk Producers is one of the nation’s largest and most progressive dairy cooperatives, with 32 wholly owned subsidiaries, 12 processing plants, and 8 joint ventures including Fair Oaks Farms, Continental Dairy Facilities, Continental Dairy Facilities Southwest, Mill Haven Foods, Select Custom Solutions, GreenLink and Select Services. With over 1,000 employees, the Select Milk family of companies impacts all aspects of the dairy farm business and at the heart of our family of companies, is you.
"We strive to go above and beyond what’s expected in providing for our families, leading our employees, caring for our land and animals, serving our customers, producing quality milk, and serving one another. This commitment is more than our business, it’s in our culture and our character. We believe in being accountable, in doing what’s right, in performing at our best, in setting a higher standard."
Select Milk Producers and its subsidiaries offer attractive compensation and a best-in-class benefits package that includes but is not limited to medical, vision, dental, life insurance, and more that can be tailored for you and your family. Other benefits for eligible employees include 401(k) up to 6% company match, life and disability insurance, and paid holidays & vacation. We are proud to promote an equal employment opportunity workplace.  

Position: Project Development Manager
Location: Dallas, TX (REMOTE)
Reporting Relationship: Chief Operating Officer
FLSA: Salary, Exempt
Company Information
Greenlink Sustainability Partners, LLC (“GreenLink Partners”) is proud to partner with Select Milk Producers, Inc. one of the nation’s largest and most progressive dairy cooperatives, with 110 family-owned dairies, 32 wholly owned subsidiaries, 12 processing plants with joint venture plants, and eight joint ventures.
Through its affiliation with GreenLink Partners, Select Milk Producers, Inc. seeks to leverage synergies between dairy farming, agricultural technology, and renewable energy technology. This partnership helps to extend the cooperative's reach and effectiveness in implementing sustainable practices and promoting innovation within the industry, ensuring they remain at the forefront of the dairy production sector.
Position Overview
This position plays an integral role in our origination, acquisition, and development processes. The Project Development Manager will work on a wide range of tasks related to project development and project execution. This position is responsible for contributing, at a very early stage, to the evaluation and screening of potential self-development, co-development, acquisition, and other investment opportunities, specifically by assessing “fit” with overall strategy, identifying and mitigating project development risks, and assessing solution partners. Initial responsibilities will include the establishment of critical internal systems to acquire and organize data and information used for assessing waste-to-energy solutions, distributed generation solutions, and utility-scale solar and wind solutions at GreenLink Sustainability Partners. The Project Development Manager will coordinate efforts with management, internal subject matter experts, external subject matter consultants, and clients.
Primary Responsibilities
Project Management, Strategic Planning and Innovation:* Direct development efforts, including project execution plans, work breakdown structures, scheduling, procurement, permitting, spill prevention and response plans, standard operating procedures, etc.
* Direct development activities throughout the project life cycles and work collaboratively with senior management, design and engineering consultants, and construction and operational teams.
* Create and implement a "Phasegate" or "Tollgate" project management system to organize company workflow and prioritize the pipeline of new projects.
* Diligently track and evaluate project risk at every stage of the development cycle and recommend mitigation strategies during the project "Phasegate" review cycles.
* Consider innovative ways to undertake work, promoting automation and efficiencies in day-to-day work streams.
* Create a development implementation matrix for distributed generation that can be utilized in the assessment of greenfield opportunities.
* Create a technology innovation matrix to evaluate the viability of all sustainability opportunities at a dairy farm, including, but not limited to, traditional solar distributed generation, batteries, manure management strategies, and energy resiliency.
* Evaluate all development opportunities with a focus on anticipating future energy demand requirements.
* Coordinate and support green fielding activities for utility-scale solar and wind projects with an emphasis on identifying required buildable land clusters, interconnection points, permitting, and identifying best-in-class solution partners.
* Create and curate a robust database on electricity interconnection and offtake requirements and opportunities.
* Create and curate a robust database on gas interconnection and offtake requirements and opportunities.
* Create and curate a robust database of Solution Providers.
* Support the startup of new projects until the operations team is ready to perform independently.
* Collaborate with senior management and the legal team to negotiate favorable land option terms, permitting terms, and other legal contract terms required to further the development of a renewable energy project.
* Coordinate with other departments, consultants, attorneys, utilities, regulatory agencies, government agencies, and major customers.
* Nurture and sustain relationships with relevant authorities, consultants, the community, and other stakeholders.


Financial and Analytical Tasks:* Support the creation of financial models for new projects, business ventures, and asset-based investments to help direct senior leadership’s decision-making.
* Meet project milestones punctually and within budget, ensuring successful development until the Ready to Build (RTB) stage.
* Consistently deliver informative monthly pipeline and leads reports to headquarters.


Technical and Operational Support:* Support accounting colleagues in managing the logistics of backend paperwork and revenue streams.
* Support the development and maintenance of GreenLink Sustainability Partner’s data-gathering systems or platforms.
* Manage and support all Anderson Optimization GIS initiatives.
* Provide technical assistance and support to senior management when required.
* Promote and monitor company and contractor safety policies and practices.
* Initiate actions to ensure compliance with project management and quality management processes and procedures.
* Assume other job-related duties as assigned.


Preferred Qualifications
Project Management and Development Skills:* Development and project management experience managing solar or wind project land use permitting from early stage through financial close and construction.
* Formal project management training.
* Ability to mobilize team members to deliver projects on time and under budget.
* Experience leading or managing a team (direct reports or consultant team).
* Proven ability to lead teams and work in a team environment.


Financial and Analytical Skills:* Financial analysis and budgeting skills.
* Expert in utilizing MS Excel for data analysis, budgeting and planning, and optimizing schedules.


Technical Expertise and Software Proficiency:* Expert in integrating Scheduling IT tools and software (with costs and resource requirements preferred.)
* Knowledge of energy distribution and grid complexities.
* Knowledge of main configuration and general arrangements of network (substations, overhead lines, and cable) infrastructures preferred.


Risk and Quality Management:* Expert in risk management and mitigation plans.
* Understanding of quality assurance processes and implementation with project structure.


Communication and Presentation Skills:* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Public presentation skills and ability to summarize concepts.


Independent Working and Orientation:* Ability to work independently to deliver program objectives.
* Results oriented.
* Detail orientated.


Competencies & Characteristics Required
To effectively perform the duties this position, individuals must be able to demonstrate several competencies which include:* Must be able to communicate clearly, both written and orally, and write routine reports and correspondence.
* Must possess strong interpersonal and collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of internal and external constituencies in a diverse business community.
* Must be comfortable with a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Must have a focus on creating value for the company.
* Must desire to listen to community interests and integrate into project development.
* Must be passionate and enthusiastic about sustainability initiatives within the agricultural sector.
* Must be a self-starter with desire to succeed.
* Must possess integrity and accountability.


Required Education and Experience* Bachelor’s degree with 3-5 years relevant experience required; Project Management Certificate preferred.
* Must have experience in Project Delivery.
* Must be computer savvy and proficient with Microsoft Office and Project Management Software (e.g. Primavera)


Minimum Requirements* Must successfully complete pre-employment drug test and a background check.
* Must have proof of legal authorization to work in USA.


Physical Requirements* May be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time and demonstrate manual dexterity while performing job duties.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to talk, see, and hear; use hands to handle objects, and reach with hands and arms.
* Must be able to concentrate for extended periods of time, paying attention to detail.
* Requires constant operation of standard office machines, including computer.
* Requires frequent ability to move freely about the office building.


Environment/Work Location:* Environment involved is regularly inside the office.
* The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.


Additional Information*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work. This is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities. Employees are expected to perform duties assigned and directed by management, which may be modified when deemed appropriate by management.**Select Milk Producers and its subsidiaries* *offer an attractive compensation and a best-in-class benefits package that can be tailored for you and your family. We are proud to* *promote an equal employment opportunity workplace.*

title: Senior Project Manager / Construction Manager
description:
VCI is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business providing project management, construction management, and engineering services to public and private clients world-wide. We offer competitive salaries, full benefits, continuing education, certifications, and looking to expand on our already extensive base of experience. Together we can have an active role in "*SHAPING TODAY, SECURING TOMORROW."*

VCI is currently seeking an onsite full-time Engineer, Architect, or Construction Management Professional to join our team at the Grand Island VA Medical Center in Grand Island, Nebraska. This Project Manager / Construction Manager will assist the VA Engineering Staff in the implementation of the Electronic Health Record Modernization (EHRM) Program. This includes monitoring the construction contractor's work effort for compliance with project contract requirements on a non-personal services basis.

**Required Responsibilities include:**

The Project Manager / Construction Manager (CM-PM) position is an owner’s representative position who will be supporting the Resident Engineer Staff in the management of the EHRM construction program. The Project Manager / Construction Manager will be required to perform services including, but not limited to, the following (in no particular order):

* Professional experience shall include the ability to read and interpret construction documents, as well as communicate effectively with project construction team members.
* Experience on healthcare projects/facilities shall be preferred. CM-PMs shall provide EHRM project construction management and shall provide decisive direction in regard to business, technical and project management involving multi-disciplinary and diverse functional activities.
* The Project Manager / Construction Manager shall be responsible for the overall management, in terms of technical quality, cost and schedule. They shall maintain daily progress reports and inspection reports and shall lead the inspection and quality assurance team assigned to projects to ensure timely and effective project oversight.
* The Project Manager / Construction Manager will be responsible for conducting and carrying out portions of daily inspections of site work and building construction work, documenting discrepancies, code violations, improper materials, or techniques in the application of materials, substandard or poor-quality workmanship.
* The Project Manager / Construction Manager must be able to monitor schedules on various aspects of ongoing daily activities, keep thorough records of all construction-related matters, maintain accurate and complete job files including as-built drawings and specifications, maintain an inventory of materials, supplies and equipment, and monitor the quantity of materials used in the contract administration and execution of the project.
* The CM-PM must be able to identify progress delays, recommend appropriate corrective measures, and assist in the documentation of the administration of construction contract changes.
* The CM-PM must be able to conduct or attend weekly project meetings to monitor project status, schedule, discuss problems, and resolve issues accordingly. Construction Manger must also provide written feedback and recommendations to the Senior Resident Engineer on all information reviewed and work inspected.
* CM-PM will review contractor’s proposed utility services and/or facility operation/interruption plans and provide comment/recommendations to Senior Resident Staff.
* The Project Manager / Construction Manager will be responsible for reviewing contractor's submittals and RFIs, testing/inspections reports, and pay applications for accuracy and acceptability, and then submit a written recommendation for final approval authority on the payment.
* Must be able to communicate fluently in English.

**Education and Qualifications:** 

* Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, or related field from an accredited 4- year college or university and fifteen (15) years of experience in management of facility construction projects including supervision of engineering, design and construction, schedule control, cost management and program budgeting, and overall project management activities.
* Educational requirement may be substituted by eight (8) additional years of directly related experience.
* Understanding of the role of owner, architect-engineer, contractor, and subcontractor relationships
* Personnel are expected to be proficient using Microsoft Office software applications and automation equipment, and have sufficient written and verbal communication skills to support VA.

**Salary:** $85K – $100K per year

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $95,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) 4% Match
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 11+ years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Grand Island, NE 68803: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Commercial Building Auditor
description:
**Why Join the Willdan Team**  
We are motivated to solve some of tomorrow’s biggest obstacles – especially those in energy and infrastructure. Our employees want to make a difference, and we have the aspiration, resources, and technical know-how to do it. Our rapid growth and successes over the past five decades stem from our ability to think big while also paying special attention to project quality and customer service.  
Willdan's work culture blends the stability of an established organization with a reputation for quality, flexibility, and opportunities of a progressive, growing company. We value and enjoy the opportunity to come to work every day and make a real, positive impact on our society and the environment.  
Willdan is seeking a Commercial Building Energy Auditor to join our innovative and creative team. The qualified individual will be responsible for audits of existing commercial, industrial, and other buildings. The Energy Auditor will play an important role in support and implementation of existing building custom energy efficiency programs. This will include consulting on individual existing building projects as well as developing tools, energy efficiency measures and delivery strategies to support the programs as a whole.

\*  
Essential Duties and Responsibilities\*

* Conduct outreach and education to targeted customers and schedule energy efficiency audits.
* Work directly with building owners, architects, and engineers to understand their energy conservation goals and gather the information needed to analyze energy saving options.
* Assist management staff to quantify energy savings, financial savings and other customer benefits.
* Communicate energy conservation measures effectively to both technical and non-technical project team members to assist them in making informed design decisions.
* Review Construction Documents to perform the necessary take offs for lighting, occupancy sensor controls, and daylighting strategies to verify the characteristics of the envelope and HVAC systems.
* Prepare reports detailing the achievement of energy saving goals, which incudes working with energy analysts to develop these reports and project mangers to ensure high quality results and deliverables.
* Manage a high-volume portfolio of projects at different stages of a consulting process.
* Develop and maintain relationships with customers, vendors and subcontractors.
* Work in cross functional teams including program support as needed.
* Perform lead follow ups, go to sites for customer meetings and evaluate facility.
* Engagement in any and all geographical areas critical to program success.

\*  
Job Requirements / Qualifications\*

* High School Diploma or general education degree (GED).
* Previous experience with existing building custom energy efficiency programs.
* Knowledge of building design, renovation and constructions processes, and/or building operation.
* Demonstrated experience with building energy analysis including: interpreting complex information; performing cost/benefit analysis; assessing consequences and impacts of alternative system options.
* Previous experience developing and supporting energy efficiency measures, strategies and deliveries in IOU sponsored existing building custom energy efficiency programs.
* Knowledge of thermodynamics, physics, and mathematics preferred.
* Knowledge of utility sponsored energy efficiency programs, specifically those that target existing buildings preferred.
* Knowledge of energy codes and standards such as ASHRAE 55, 62.1, 90.1, 189.1, IECC preferred.
* Professional Engineer or Registered Architect or qualifications to enable achieving licensure preferred.
* Industry related certifications such as certified energy manager (CEM), building energy modeling professional (BEMP), LEED accredited professional, building energy assessment professional (BEAP) and/or commissioning authority (CxA) preferred.
* Ability to prioritize multiple projects and tasks to ensure timely delivery of high-quality deliverables.
* Above average competence with Microsoft Office Suite with emphasis on Excel for data analysis and energy simulation support.
* Valid Drivers License.

\*  
EEO Non-Discrimination and ADA Reasonable Accommodation Statement\*  
Willdan is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, religion, military service or veteran status, disability, medical condition, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic testing, reproductive status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local laws and ordinances. Willdan does not discriminate on the basis of physical or mental disability where the essential functions of the job can be reasonably accommodated. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis. If you need reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify us.  
Willdan Energy Solutions participates in E-Verify.

Work Location: In person

title: Creative Project Manger
description:
**Job Brief**
-------------



As Creative Project Manager, you will serve our internal creative team by acting as the primary day-to-day liaison throughout the project lifecycle.



The Creative Project Manager will work closely with the Sr. Technical Project Manager to ensure alignment across all aspects of the program. You will be responsible for ensuring that deadlines and milestones are met as scoped, identifying potential scope creep and flagging risks to the project plan, ensuring adherence to client brand standards across all deliverables, leading Creative team status meetings, while managing to Latcha’s standards of quality and risk management.



PRIMARY OBJECTIVE: The creative project manager is responsible for creating and maintaining project schedules for all creative deliverables across a multi-channel marketing program for a large automotive OEM brand. Our marketing platform includes email, direct mail and SMS capabilities. There are customizable templates, API integrations for third-party application and options for enhanced media services including SEM, SEO, display and social media advertising. The creative Project Manager bring their experience in all of these channels to our team.



MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams on development of creative deliverables including template development for email, print, digital/display marketing.
* Develop timelines and project plans to lead the creative team from start-of-work to completion.
* Responsible for oversight and successful delivery of quick-turn client requests, including ad-hoc creative requirements.

Partners with the account team to manage and document all client approvals.  
* 

QUALIFICATIONS:



* Bachelor’s (4-year) degree is preferred.
* Minimum five years experience in digital project management/CRM in an agency environment.


* Proficient in MS Office Suite and experienced with project management solutions such as SmartSheet


* Experience managing complex projects on aggressive timelines while communicating project status to cross-functional teams.


* Experience in supporting OEM-level automotive clients/projects is preferred, but not required.


* Multi-Channel Marketing experience required

title: Help Desk Technician
description:
**Job Summary:**

The Help Desk Technician provides tier 1 and 2 end user support for enterprise technology, including workstations, basic network and telephony systems, remote users, etc. This individual will effectively interface with staff and/or third parties to understand and diagnose issues; and follow best practices to isolate and effectively resolve them. Coordinates basic user technical training and remediation activities, oversees information resources repository of instructional materials for user applications and makes recommendations for additions to learning aids and tools. This individual will work with a team to solve problems creatively and timely, with the ability to escalate issues to senior technical staff as needed.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

· Maintains endpoint systems, installs new hardware and/or modifies existing hardware, and resolves application issues.

· Maintains VOIP phone and paging system, installing new hardware, adding and removing users and accounts.

· Installs and maintains peripheral devices including printers, switches, routers, Wi-Fi, and other equipment.

· Coordinates activities in support of user training and assistance requests for all programs.

· Maintains email and intranet services, adding and removing users and accounts.

· Collaborates with Help Desk Manger to review and analyze hardware and software needs; recommends changes.

· Interact with users via phone, e-mail, and IM/chat in the effort to resolve issues in the most efficient manner.

· Work within a centralized ticketing system to respond to users and document pathways to resolution.

· Monitor and prioritize incidents and tickets. Escalate and/or work in tandem with appropriate people from within and outside the organization on unresolved issues.

· Trains users in learning new company-provided applications and assists in problem solving for applications issues.

**Required Qualifications/Skills/Abilities:**

· Excellent communication, documentation, multitasking and customer service skills.

· Excellent workstation and network troubleshooting skills.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Advanced competency in Microsoft Office Suite, Visio, Project, Windows Servers, Azure Active Directory, and/or related software.

· Minimum 2-5 years of experience providing IT support, including Microsoft Windows, Anti-virus, Spam filter services, Active Directory, VOIP phone systems.

· Ability to write new and update existing documentation that supports updates for IT Runbooks.

· Assist with planning and scheduling for IT projects

**Preferred Skills/Abilities:** 

· Develop experience in Providing Tier III support without assistance other than supervision and prioritization.

· Entry level experience with LAN/WLAN, VPN, Microsoft 365, ZOOM, Azure, AWS, and HP computers.

· Entry level experience with Windows Server.

Education and Experience:

· At least three years of experience in user technical support required.

· A+, Network+, and/or similar certifications preferred.

· ITIL and/or Similar Certification preferred.

**Physical Requirements:** 

· Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

· Must be able to lift 50 pounds at times.

· May be required to work on-call or long hours in case of network malfunction.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.00 - $33.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

* The Construction Manager/Project Manager will be responsible for reviewing contractor's submittals and RFIs, testing/inspections reports, and pay applications for accuracy and acceptability, and then submit a written recommendation for final approval authority on the payment.
* Must be able to communicate fluently in English.

Education and Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, or related field from an accredited 4- year college or university and seven (7) years of experience in management of facility construction projects including supervision of engineering, design and construction, schedule control, cost management and program budgeting, and overall project management activities.
* Educational requirement may be substituted by fifteen (15) years of directly related experience.
* Understanding of the role of owner, architect-engineer, contractor, and subcontractor relationships
* Personnel are expected to be proficient using Microsoft Office software applications and automation equipment, and have sufficient written and verbal communication skills to support VA.

title: Outside Sales & Project Manger
description:
**Overview:**  
We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Outside Sales Project Manager to join our team. As our Outside Sales Representative Project Manager, you will be responsible for generating new business opportunities and building strong relationships with clients and well as managing those projects through our services. This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys working independently, has a passion for sales, organizing their customer, working with them to fulfill established expectation, and thrives in a fast-paced environment.

**Sales Duties:**  
- Identify and pursue new business opportunities through prospecting, cold calling, and networking  
- Conduct market research to identify potential customers and industry trends  
- Develop and maintain a strong pipeline of leads and opportunities  
- Meet or exceed sales targets and goals on a regular basis  
- Build and maintain long-term relationships with clients through excellent customer service and account management  
- Present product demonstrations and provide technical sales support to clients  
- Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with customers  
- Analyze market data and trends to develop effective sales strategies

**Project Management Duties:**

- Develop comprehensive project plans outlining timelines, resources, and milestones for exterior restoration projects.

- Maintain regular communication with clients to understand their needs, provide project updates, and address any concerns or questions.

- Coordinate with internal teams, subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure timely delivery of materials and services required for the project.

- Monitor project budgets, track expenses, and ensure cost-effective solutions without compromising on quality standards.

- Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure that exterior restoration work meets industry standards and client expectations.

- Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize disruptions and delays during the project lifecycle.

- Ensure compliance with building codes, permits, safety regulations, and environmental standards throughout the project.

- Generate regular progress reports, status updates, and documentation to keep stakeholders informed and accountable.

- Address project-related issues promptly, troubleshoot challenges, and make informed decisions to keep the project on track.

- Oversee the successful completion of exterior restoration projects within specified timelines, budgets, and quality parameters.

**Sales Skills:**  
- Proven experience in business development, preferably in the technology sales industry  
- Strong ability to negotiate and close sales deals  
- Excellent analytical skills to assess customer needs and provide effective solutions  
- Demonstrated track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets  
- Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to build rapport with clients  
- Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and manage time effectively  
- Strong customer service orientation with a focus on building long-term relationships

**Project Management Skills:**

- In-depth understanding of exterior restoration processes, materials, techniques, and building codes.

- Strong project planning, organization, and execution skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective client interactions, team coordination, and reporting.

- Ability to lead and motivate teams, delegate tasks, and foster a collaborative working environment.

- Analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities to address project challenges and make informed decisions.

- Financial acumen to manage project budgets, track expenses, and optimize resource allocation.

- Knowledge of relevant regulations, permits, safety protocols, and environmental considerations.

- Keen attention to detail to ensure quality standards are met, and project specifications are followed.

- Strong time management skills to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and manage project schedules efficiently.

- Focus on customer satisfaction, responsiveness to client needs, and building long-term relationships.

This is a challenging yet rewarding position that offers excellent earning potential and career growth opportunities. If you are a driven individual with a passion for sales, we would love to hear from you.

Note: All positions are paid, including internship positions.

title: CORP - Technical Recruiter
description:
Apogee is seeking a full-time **Technical Recruiter** located at our office in **Dayton, Ohio**. As part of the Talent Acquisition team the Technical Recruiter will be responsible for full-cycle recruiting, as well as assisting with proposal efforts.


***Why work with us?***



Apogee Engineering, LLC is a provider of research, engineering, operations, software, cyber, intel, training, technical services, financial and administrative expertise across an array of DOD and Federal Civilian customers. Our company was founded on the commitment of making a positive difference for our customers and our people. Apogee’s culture is infused with integrity and a passion for excellence, which has propelled us into the ranks of an elite small business company. Apogee is known for an unwavering dedication to our client's success, a warm and employee-centric work environment, and an enthusiasm to provide the right solution at the right time.


***What you'll be doing:***


* Consult with hiring manger, draft detailed job descriptions and compelling job postings, determines effective screening questions, and posts requisitions.
* Work with proposal team to develop staffing plans and perform recruiting to secure key resources necessary for submitting a competitive proposal.
* Build a network of government contracting industry professionals via LinkedIn, Clearance Jobs, etc.; leverage relationships to source qualified candidates for open positions.
* Research and write job descriptions for new positions.
* Develop creative sourcing strategies and sources talent utilizing the ATS, job boards, postings, referrals, and attending events. Monitor sourcing strategies to determine effectiveness and adjust as needed.
* Consult with candidates, find out what drives them, and guide candidates through the hiring process.
* Screens talent to ensure candidates are qualified and fully vetted for the role.
* Negotiates offers, prepares offer letters, and follows up to ensure success in closing candidates.
* Attends/conducts meetings with hiring managers to determine current and upcoming needs.
* Works special projects as assigned; including new contract transitions and corporate projects such as process improvement or innovation initiatives.
* Travel may be required for site visits or career fairs.


**What you'll need:**


* One of the following education/experience combinations:
	+ Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 8 years relevant experience; OR,
	+ Master's degree with a minimum of 6 years relevant experience; OR,
	+ 14+ years' relevant experience in lieu of degree
* Experience with DoD recruiting and/or technical recruiting is highly desired
* Experience cold calling and building relationships
* Experience identifying, engaging, and screening candidates
* Experience assessing candidate's qualifications against Performance Work Statement (PWS) and Statements of Work (SOW)
* Experience with negotiations and selling the value of the position
* Strong verbal and written communication skills


***Benefits & Compensation:***


* Apogee offers two medical plans, a high deductible health plan with a HSA and HRA and a traditional POS plan with co-pays, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, PTO, paid holidays, parental, military, and jury duty paid leaves. Regular part time employees scheduled for twenty-four or more hours per work week are eligible for benefits on a pro-rated basis.
* This position is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus.
* The base pay for this position is **$80,000 to $120,000**. Base pay is based on a number of factors and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, experience, skills, abilities, training and education.


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: AVP, Treasury ALM Manger
description:
**Summary:**

Are you interested in taking charge of important financial management functions within a dynamic finance team? As an AVP, Treasury ALM Manger, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, modeling, and reporting on interest rate risk and asset liability management. Your expertise will also contribute to the oversight of our investment portfolio and the forecasting of organizational revenues.

**Essential Responsibilities:**

- Engaging in liquidity risk, interest rate risk, investments, and balance sheet funding management.

- Participating in capital market transactions, including asset sales, securitizations, and wholesale purchasing.

- Ensuring regulatory compliance, including conducting capital and liquidity stress tests, and tracking key financial metrics.

- Developing and implementing asset and liability management and hedging strategies.

- Contributing to Asset Liability Management Committee meetings and reporting.

- Analyzing financial data to understand trends and financial developments.

- Managing the organization’s short-term cash flow forecasts and coordinating daily treasury operations.

- Overseeing fixed income investment portfolio management, including due diligence and compliance.

- Fulfilling additional responsibilities as required and collaborating with team members at various organizational levels.

**Requirements:**

- Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field; MBA or CFA is a plus.

- Analytical thinker with strong technical skillset.

- 10+ years in financial services with knowledge in accounting, valuation, and regulations.

- Expertise in financial instruments and balance sheet management.

- Solid experience with ALM and liquidity modeling, funds transfer pricing, and cash management.

- Experience with financial modeling software, particularly Empyrean, or similar platforms.

- Proficiency with econometric modeling tools and a background in SAS or R is desirable.

- Practical knowledge of SQL, VBA, and Python, including dashboard creation.

- Understanding of relational database design and development is advantageous.

- Independent initiative with the ability to manage multiple projects.

- Strong project management and excellent communication skills.

**Salary Range:**

$135,000-$180,000/Annual

It's important to acknowledge that the provided salary figures serve as a broad framework. In determining compensation, our company evaluates a spectrum of elements, including the role's specific duties, the individual's professional background, educational achievements, specialized training, and essential competencies. Additionally, we consider internal parity and external market dynamics to ensure our offers are fair and competitive. Our comprehensive total rewards package reflects our commitment to employee well-being, encompassing a variety of health, financial, and additional benefits to support our team members holistically.

**Benefits:**

We provide a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefits program that goes beyond monetary rewards. We are committed to the professional and personal development of our employees, fostering a culture where contributions are valued and visible.

- Retirement savings plan with employer matching.

- Comprehensive health, vision, dental, and income protection insurance.

- Performance-based incentive programs.

- Support for continuing education and professional growth.

- Generous paid time off along with recognized holidays.

- Discounted rates on various loan programs.

- Access to professional development, training, and coaching resources.

- Wellness initiatives, including discounted gym memberships.

Ready to make an impact in a role where your expertise is valued? Submit your application today for an opportunity to become a key player in our team’s success.

title: Technical Marketing
description:
**Position Summary** 

The Technical Marketing/Content Manager is a key role that supports the overall American Lighting team, working closely with team members to create and edit a variety of content across multiple platforms and brands for the company. An ideal candidate is articulate, passionate and creative.  
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**   
The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:

* Manage published content across multiple platforms (print and digital) and brands (American Lighting, Prizm and Proluxe)
* Manage product messaging, awareness, positioning, and promotion by collaborating with the Marketing, Product Management and Sales teams to develop messaging.
* Prepare written content for marketing initiatives (instruction manuals, specification sheets, new product e-blasts, how-to videos, press releases, case studies, etc.)
* Work with Marketing, Product Development and Sales teams to develop launch plans and customer communication strategies.
* Create and disseminate social media posts
* Act as liaison between the Sales/ Marketing/ Product Development
* Ensure technical product information is always accurate and current
* Works with Marketing Department to generate presentation material.
* Provide training and support to customer service and agents as needed
* Other duties as may be required

**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities)** 

* Bachelor’s Degree
* 3-5 years of technical marketing experience in the lighting or electrical industry
* Proven experience in document/content development, to include demonstrated writing, editing, formatting, and proofreading skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills. The Technical Marketing/Content Manager will work with a diverse staff to include Sales, Marketing, Product Development, Engineering, Purchasing, and others who have unique personalities. The successful Technical Marketing/Content Manger must be a good listener, patient, and empathetic.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and organizational skills
* Must be able to manage multiple projects without constant supervision and deliver to established deadlines
* Must be resourceful in reaching deadlines and quickly identify and communicate obstacles
* Dedicated, assertive, a team player and detail oriented
* Excellent understanding of segmentation, vertical markets, and the development of a marketing communication plan
* Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
* Experience in Adobe Creative Suite and 3D animation and video editing software a plus

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**   
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to, stand, sit; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision requirements due to computer work
* Light to moderate lifting is occasionally required
* Regular, predictable attendance is required
* Moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phone, and printers, light traffic).
* Ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time.

**Note** 

American Lighting’s success is in large part due to teamwork; we strive on always being available to assist each other to the best of our ability; even if it means we may be required step out of our job description.

Our culture is one of “*What can I do to help you*” never “*Sorry, it’s not my job*”, this is unacceptable.
