title: System Validation Technical Project Manager
description:
**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* Expertise in Product development or Product validation cycle of consumer electronics product
* Responsible for coordinating team activities and taking the ownership of project execution
* Drive and execute validation to meet key deadlines and priority goals
* Clearly document test results. Keep track of bugs encountered and fixed
* Support system bring up and debug activities
* Clearly communicate test plans and results
* Should be experienced in leading team, delegating work, monitoring work progress, KPI tracking and Status Reporting to customer
* Candidate should have good presentation skills and be able to provide executive level status reporting as well as proficiency in using online project tracking tools.
* Should be ready to extend the responsibility in Hiring Process, Team Building, Careers & Training Development, Knowledge Management, Team Mentoring

**Required Skills (Technical Competency):**

* Highly skilled in embedded testing - Automation scripting and Manual testing.
* Working knowledge of Android CE devices
1. Should have testing expertise with peripheral devices like Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Camera, Audio, Sensors etc and related testing tools
2. Should be familiarized with core embedded system concepts like MCU, SoC, Memory etc
3. Should have knowledge of android tools and commands

* Expertise with Python and should be capable of doing shell/ batch scripting as required. Nice to have: C, Java.
1. Working expertise with Python libraries like pandas, numpy, opencv etc. Should be able to find and use new libraries as required.

* Should have knowledge of test automation frameworks and work experience in Android and iOS apps automation with Appium
* Should be capable to work on both MAC and Windows operating systems
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Should be able to communicate effectively and positively

title: Architectural Project Manager
description:
**Competitive Pay + Excellent Benefits + Collaborative Environment! Innovative Firm!**  
  
This Jobot Job is hosted by: Luke Hoyt  
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" buttonand sending us your resume.  
Salary: $100,000 - $120,000 per year  
  
**A bit about us:**

  
  
A full-service commercial interior architecture, planning and design firm with over 40 years of experience in Southern California. The firm is seeking a motivated and experienced Project Manager specializing in commercial tenant improvement projects. Our projects include commercial office, industrial/logistics, manufacturing, retail, medical and dental. Our clients include developers, landlords, property managers, owners, general contractors and trade partners.  
  
**Why join us?**

  
  
We invest in growth of our team members to advance in their careers.  
We are focused on developing and expanding practice areas and encouraging excellence.  
We sponsor certification for NCIDQ, IDEX California®, LEED and WELL exams.  
We offer a professional environment that is positive, collaborative, fast-paced, and friendly.  
We are located in Central Irvine, near the Irvine Spectrum, with easy freeway access.  
We participate in lunch and learn presentations, and employee appreciation lunches.  
We offer a very competitive compensation structure with an excellent benefits package (including medical, dental, vision, retirement plan and additional benefits).  
Additional benefits and perks include: pet insurance, health and wellness reimbursements, professional programs and continuing education reimbursements.  
  
**Job Details**

  
  
Project Management:   
  
Lead, manage and oversee all aspects of the design process throughout all phases from initial design to the completion of construction.   
Collaborate effectively with internal team members (which may include Technical Director and Production team) to achieve a successful project outcome.   
Work closely and communicate the goals and objectives of each project with consultants, vendors and contractors.   
Manage the entire project team to ensure that client specifications and expectations are fulfilled.   
Help prepare project proposals, schedules, negotiate contracts and fees, coordinate bidding process.   
Ensure projects are meeting key milestones and stay within budget.   
  
Client Relations:   
  
Cultivate long-term client relationships through exceptional service; providing clients with personalized attention, clear and excellent verbal and written communication, responsiveness and knowledge sharing.   
Build partnerships with new clients and industry partners to grow client base.   
Represent us in a professional manner – working with a variety of consultants, vendors, engineers, general contractors, landlords, property managers and property owners.   
Leadership and Management:  
  
Mentor and support growth of team members.   
Contribute to recruitment of new talent for the office.   
Continue with professional development (continuing education, attending seminars, stay up-to-date on codes and trends, licensing and certifications, participate in professional industry associations).  
Maintain high professional standards at all times (communication, courtesy, service, appearance, business etiquette).   
Skills and Qualifications  
  
Minimum 8-10 years of relevant Architectural or interior design experience  
Strong leadership and business acumen, as well as the ability to manage people effectively  
Has the proven ability to self-manage under pressure and handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment  
Must communicate clearly and effectively (both verbal and written)  
Solid critical-thinking skills with the willingness and ability to make decisions  
Technical, detail and constructability skills  
Must be detail-oriented, highly organized, and work well with a variety of staff  
Demonstrate experience working on all phases of a project  
Attain the firm’s goals relative to design, technical and management excellence  
Required to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines  
Able to work independently as well as interact with the team  
Degree in Interior Design, Interior Architecture or Architecture  
Excellent working knowledge of AutoCAD 22 or above, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook  
Knowledgeable of 2022 CBC and Accessibility Code Compliance  
Should be capable of completing a basic accessibility survey  
Working knowledge of reviewing a full set of construction documents  
Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the profession  
Architectural License or CID Certification preferred  
Positive attitude, strong work ethic  
Strong business development skills a plus  
Be a U.S. citizen, or already possess a work visa for working in the U.S.  
  
Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Office Manager
description:
**WHY 3D TECHNICAL SERVICES?**

3D Technical Services was formed in 1998 from a group of experienced personnel in the Instrument and Control industry. This group of Project Managers, Instrument Technicians, Fitters, and Electricians developed a reputation for quality work throughout the Bay Area.

Our goal is to provide our customers with a superior source of quality instrument and automation services by utilizing our extensive experience and knowledge. We pledge to conduct our business by treating all customers, employees, suppliers, and the community with honesty, fairness, respect, and integrity. We support our local community and youth organizations to help promote the generation of tomorrow.

 

**YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY:**

The Office Manager role is responsible for providing administrative support to the executive team and/or specific departments as assigned. This position will provide general assistance to all levels of staff.

 

**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**

* Act as liaison between executive staff and others (i.e., internal employees, external vendors, suppliers, clients, etc.) in an organized, prompt and professional manner, and serves as a central clearing position for general information.
* Oversee/process day-to-day administrative items: payroll, timesheets, union pension & benefit paperwork filing, invoice management, payroll taxes, supplier communications, expense reports, etc.
* Performs filing, typing, data input and other clerical support to all other departments and personnel, as directed.
* Answer external inquiries and directs calls to appropriate staff, and takes messages, as necessary.
* *The duties and responsibilities are intended to describe the general nature and scope of work being performed by this position. This is not a complete listing and other duties will be assigned based on the position’s role within the business unit.*

 

**WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:**

* Knowledge of payroll taxes- perform weekly payments to FTB and IRS, submit quarterly and yearly payroll reports.
* Computer, filing, attention to detail and strong analytical skills are necessary
* Proficient in using a computer and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, etc.), and QuickBooks Pro
* Prioritize and proactively manage multiple tasks, changing priorities as necessary
* Self-motivated, proactive and an effective team player with efficient oral and written communication skills
* Interact effectively and professionally with all levels of employees, both management and staff alike, vendors, clients, and others

 

**WHAT YOU BRING TO US:**

* Associate degree in Business Administration or related discipline or equivalent experience.
* Minimum 2 years’ experience in office administrative work and bring a wide skill set including: time management, organization, and project management skills
* Proficient technical skills including: Detailed knowledge of QuickBooks Pro, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)

 

**BENEFITS:** 

* $30- $39.50 salary range based on experience
* 10 days PTO per year plus 9 paid holidays
* Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance

Employment Type

Full-time

title: Bilingual Sr. Technical Project Manager
description:
**Sr. Technical Project Manager (Bilingual in English/Mandarin)**  
99 Ranch Market is the largest Asian supermarket chain in the United States, with over 60 store locations and more coming. While we continue to expand, we aim to provide the best Omni channel shopping experience. As the company's newest and fastest-growing team, the e-commerce squad works like a startup. We not only fulfill the company’s motto, “For 100, We Try Harder.” — We “Outthink the Rest 99%, Be That 1% of Dreamers.” We value ownership, diversity, forward-thinking, creativity, and transparency in every aspect of the work we do. If you would like to challenge yourself and still want to have fun at work, you are looking at the right place. We would like to have YOU join us and create a playful culture together!  
  
**Position Summary:**We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Technical Project Manager to join our company. As a Technical Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing various software and/or hardware projects within the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and stakeholders, to ensure successful project delivery.  
  
**Responsibilities:*** Manage the planning, execution, and delivery of software and/or hardware projects, ensuring they are completed within scope, timeline, and budget
* Define project objectives, requirements, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders and product managers
* Develop and maintain project plans, including task schedules, resource allocation, and risk management strategies
* Coordinate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth project workflow and alignment of project goals
* Identify and manage project dependencies, risks, and issues, implementing appropriate mitigation strategies
* Track project progress, provide regular status updates, and report on key metrics to stakeholders
* Participate in discovery calls to understand requirements and road maps
* Utilize project management tools, such as Jira and Confluence, to track tasks, document project details, and manage project artifacts

**Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred)
* 5 + years of experience as a Technical Project Manager in one of the following areas (Retail, Warehouse, Supply chain or E- Commerce).
* Strong knowledge of platforms, technologies, and systems
* Excellent project management skills, with a track record of successfully delivering complex technical projects on time and within budget
* Proficiency in project management methodologies, tools, and techniques
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate and influence stakeholders at all levels
* Problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a strategic and analytical mindset
* Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and work in a fast-paced environment
* Experience with project management tools, such as Jira and Confluence, for task tracking and documentation
* Experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus
* Experience with using communication tools such as Slack, Zoom, and Google Meet
* Experience in large-scale software development life cycle
* Bilingual proficiency in English/Mandarin
* Experience in Korber, WMS, E-Commerce, Toshiba, SAP, SOP, ERP, CRM. Project full cycle management, business sense and understanding, project management certificate (PMP, CISSP), AI, LLM (large language model), machine learning.

  
**Employment type:** Full Time, M-F 9:00am to 5:30pm  
  
**Location:** 6338 Regio Ave., Buena Park, CA 90620  
  
**Salary:** The rate of pay is between $120K - $160K per hour. This is general guideline only and not guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) the responsibilities of the job, your education, skills, qualifications, experience and location.  
  
**Benefits:*** Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Life and AD&D Insurance with other optional plans
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with 4% Company Match
* Paid Time Off
* Long-Term Service Award
* Employee Referral Program
* Employee Discount
* Benefit Hub - enjoy discounts, rewards, and perks on thousands of brands in a variety of categories: Travel, Auto, Electronics, Apparel, Local Deals, Education, Entertainment, Restaurants, Health and Wellness, Beauty and Spa, Tickets, Sports, and Outdoors

  
**Privacy Policy:**By submitting your information, you acknowledge that you have read our privacy policy linked below and consent to receive communications from us:  
  
**Disclaimer:**Tawa Group dba 99 Ranch Market, is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Electrical Project Manager
description:

Word

Autocad


Revit


Electrical Estimating Software


Integrated Accounting Software

* Knowledge of photovoltaic power generation systems
* Understanding of HVAC and refrigeration systems operation

* Understanding of hydraulic and mechanical systems
* Knowledge of classified location installation methods (hazardous locations)
* Mechanical skills and knowledgeable tool usage is a plus

**Education:**

* Bachelors' degree in Construction Management, Construction Engineering, or equivalent experience in a related field

**Experience:**

* 3-5 years of experience in Construction Project Management and or Electrical Estimating, or equivalent experience in a related field

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Establishing viable project pursuits for engineered or design build projects
* Meeting with facility owners and or general contractors to develop project scope for design build projects
* Establishing project proposal and pertinent documents
* Assuming overall responsibility for a profitable, well-constructed, safe project, completed in a timely manner
* Determining the most cost effective construction methods and use of personnel, material, equipment and subcontractors
* Reviewing and approving subcontractor selections and invoicing
* Establishing field labor needs for managed projects
* Fulfilling all commitments or revising commitments when circumstances change significantly and previous commitments cannot be met
* Advising key stakeholders of unavoidable delays
* Supporting and assuming responsibility for decisions made
* Taking initiative and doing what it takes to achieve goals
* Paying close attention to the specifics and details of every aspect of the project or work assignment
* Noticing variances from the scope of the project and taking appropriate action to resolve discrepancies
* Checking and editing work or getting peer review to ensure accuracy
* Clearly conveying important information to all relevant parties in order to ensure the goals and modifications are clearly established and understood
* Coordinating and providing direction for the budget estimating, purchasing, engineering, accounting, cost and construction functions as they relate to the completion of the project
* Negotiating, preparing, issuing and executing change orders (proposals) and providing that information to field crew, subcontractors and other necessary parties, and preparing revisions to the original budget as a result of changes and revisions to work.
* Being able to maintain poise and professionalism under stressful or challenging situations
* Communicating in a succinct, logical, and clear manner
* Presenting recommendations and supporting conclusions with facts in order to gain the confidence of the listener
* Initiating, establishing and maintaining positive working relationships with co-workers, customers, suppliers, and subcontractors in order to facilitate construction activities, represent the organization in a professional manner and gain repeat business and customer referrals.
* Organizing, conducting and representing the company at project coordination meetings as needed
* Promoting teamwork
* Using an understanding of the audience to address different groups in the most appropriate and effective way.
* Demonstrating an understanding of technical and professional aspects of the job
* Making use of applicable technical manuals and other resources
* Seeking to improve knowledge level and remain current as to technical procedures
* Applying job knowledge at expected level of competence and maintaining thorough understanding of the project
* Staying current on technical / professional developments

**Physical Demands:** 

* Work Environment - Jobsite and office environment
* While performing the duties of this job a project manager may be regularly required to- drive to and from the jobsite, sit, talk and/or hear both in person and over the phone.
* While performing the duties of this job a project manager may required to frequently inspect the project and may be exposed to normal hazards associated with construction and various weather conditions.

Applicants should send an electronic resume to office at dahlelectric dot com or reply to this ad.

The above listed skills and desired requirements should be viewed as a guideline and not a comprehensive checklist for your employment. We encourage all applicants, regardless of background, with an interest in project management to send us a resume, thank you.  
  
Salary- DOE, see anticipated compensation range  
Benefits- medical/ dental/ vision for employee  
Retirement- 401K plan with employer 4% match  
Other- paid vacation & holidays

title: Project Manager (Audio Visual) - Honolulu, HI
description:
Welcome to Ford AV, where cutting-edge integration of audio, video, lighting, music, and technical aptitude forms the cornerstone of extraordinary experiences. If you're a tech-savvy individual deeply immersed in the intricacies of AV technology, we extend a warm invitation to join us on an exciting journey. This opportunity isn't just a job posting; it's a compelling call to channel your technical skills and creativity onto a platform where innovation and passion harmonize seamlessly. Join our team today and become a catalyst for next-generation advancements in the audio video world!

**Why Ford AV?**

Ford AV is America’s leading audiovisual solutions integrator. With over 50 years of experience, we are the complete technology provider for the nation’s top enterprise brands for design, installation, and service of professional sound systems, AV systems, video conferencing systems, networks, and security surveillance systems. Ford strives for excellence in all aspects of our work and brand including offering competitive compensation, benefits, and perks for our team members.

* Career Growth Opportunities
* Continued Education Opportunities
* Medical Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Short-term Disability
* Life Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* 401K w/company matching
* Employee Referral Bonus Program

Entry-level and senior-level positions are available. Entry-level positions will be coached and challenged through an extensive training and development period. The Project Manager is responsible for the execution of their assigned jobs, spanning from job initiation through job closeout, overseeing installation, engineering, and training. Jobs must be completed safely, to specifications, within budget, on time, and to the satisfaction of the customer. The Project Manager champions Ford safety programs with special emphasis on vehicle and job site safety for the team members they manage. They are responsible for mentoring Job Superintendents, Installation Technicians, and Engineers, and should provide leadership throughout the Ford Job Center team. The Ford Project Manager also provides estimation review with sales personnel during pre-sale work of projects.

**Qualifications**:

* Degree in Construction, Engineering, Leadership, Management, or equivalent experience preferred
* Proficiency in leadership, communication (oral and written), computers (Outlook, Excel), time-management, and problem solving
* Personal interest in audio, video, lighting systems, and/or construction
* Safety & OSHA certification awareness
* Ability to travel up to 65% of the time while in training (amount will vary based on experience and specific competency)
* Experience with scheduling software preferred
* Certifications: PMP, CTS preferred (for Senior-level position)
* Prior supervisory/management experience (for Senior-level position)
* Construction, Installation, engineering or management background preferred (for Senior-level position)

**To Apply: S**ubmit an application at www.fordav.com/careers

**Compensation**:  
Ford offers on-going industry training, competitive pay and benefits including medical, dental, vision, short-term disability and life insurance, travel Per Diem, paid time off (PTO), paid holidays, 401K with matching, industry certifications and opportunities for advancement.

**Key Words**:

*AV, A/V, Audio Video, Audio-Video, Audiovisual, Audio Visual, Videoconferencing, Telepresence, Digital Signage, Sound Systems, Audio Systems, Audio Design, Video Systems, Video Design, Video Production, Audio Production, Audio Video Contractor, Audio Engineering, Unified Communications, Broadcast, Control Systems, Digital Culture, Technical Theater, Digital Design, Lighting Design, Communication Systems, Sound Engineer, A/V Integration, A/V Integrator, Sound Engineer, Electronic Installation, Commercial Construction, Telecommunications, Interactive Media, CTS Certification, Infocomm, Avixa*

description:

title: Sr. Technical Project Manager
description:
Job Title:

Sr. Technical Project Manager

 

Job Location:

Arlington, WA

 

Newell Corporation is currently looking to add an experienced Project Manager to our team. Newell Corp. offers a wide variety of welding/fabricating/machining & assembly services at our facility located in Arlington, WA. Our Sr. Technical Project Manager would be responsible for quoting, managing projects and driving the development of our project management process and team.

 

Required Skills/Experience:

-5+ years of experience quoting complex fabrication, machining and assembly projects.

-10+ years of managing projects requiring complex fabrication, machining and assembly.

-5+ years of experience managing projects with AS9100 QMS requirements.

-2+ years of experience using CAD software such CATIA V5 or similar.

-2+ years of experience working as a welder, machinist or millwright.

-Strong work ethic, personal drive and vision to develop a project management department.

 

Preferred Skills/Experience:

-Familiarity with machining and dimensional inspection.

-Familiarity with welding, weld inspection and weld certification.

-Familiarity with inspection and metrology techniques/equipment such as CMMs or laser trackers.

-Bachelor's degree in technical field such as engineering, math, chemistry or physics.

-Advanced degree in technical field such as engineering, math, chemistry or physics.

title: Landscape Project Manager
description:
We are seeking a Landscaping Project Manager to join our team! You will oversee project planning, field management, scheduling, budgeting, and implementation.

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversee and execute all aspects of our construction projects from planning/bid to implementation
* Proactively allocate resources for project execution

* Communicate and coordinate with contractors
* Maintain the highest standards of workmanship that adhere to original plans and specifications
* Understand and execute construction plans and scope of work

* Previous experience in construction management or other related fields, preferably 3 years

* Strong leadership qualities
* Strong negotiation skills
* Deadline and detail-oriented

title: Senior Project Manager (7283)
description:
**Overview:**  
ACS Professional Staffing is looking for an employee to work on-site with our client. The Senior Project Manager position manages project activities for refueling outages, forced outages, and on-line work as assigned, providing oversight of the staff involved in planning, leading, controlling, and monitoring to ensure that work is implemented safely, with quality, on-schedule, and within budget. **This full-time position is located in Richland, WA.**

**Pay range:** **$58.90 – $102.39**

**Benefits:**

* Sick Leave: One hour of paid sick leave for every 40-hours worked (sick leave can be used after 90-days of employment)
* EAP: Employee Assistance Program
* Benefit Options: Medical, HSA, Group Life/AD&D, Voluntary Life/AD&D, Voluntary Short-Term Disability, Voluntary Long-Term Disability, Voluntary Critical Illness, Voluntary Accident, 401k (eligible after one year and 1,000 hours worked - employer match up to 4%)
* Other benefits include the following: Calm App, Access Perks

**Responsibilities:**

* Develops the budgets, including tracking cost versus budget for assigned projects. Assures proper progress and focus through frequent interface with the client, engineers, related parties, and management.
* Develop and manage contracts and interface with vendors.
* Develops project schedules commensurate with project complexity and size to be able to manage risk, accurately track progress, enforce accountability, and manage critical paths and float.
* Mentors other less experienced project managers.
* Prepare and deliver written and oral communications to various groups including senior management.
* Develop and maintain long-range plan strategies associated with assigned projects.
* Support the effective implementation of the Columbia Generating Station Self-Assessment and Corrective Action Program.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, construction management, project management, business, or related field from an accredited college or university and twenty years of experience in a technical field.
* OR an AA/AS degree in engineering, construction management, project management, business, or a related field from an accredited college or university and twenty-two years of experience in a technical field.
* OR a High School Diploma or GED and twenty-four years of experience in a technical field.
* An advanced degree in a related field of study or business may be accepted in lieu of two years of experience.
* RO/SRO License or CGS Management Certification is required.
* Project Management certification is required.
* Extensive work experience in the role of direct supervisor or project manager in the commercial nuclear industry environment focused on maintenance, operations, engineering, or construction.
* Nuclear plant operator production coordination experience, work management experience in conducting and coordinating plant production work.
* Managing complex projects, online work management, or refueling and forced outage-related activities.
* Advanced project management techniques at Commercial Nuclear Power Plants or similar facilities.

Work sponsorship is not available at this time. Third-party candidates will not be considered for this position.

Because we are a federal government contractor, we have special restrictions placed on us for hiring foreign nationals into certain key positions within the company. This particular position requires U.S. citizenship.

ACS Professional Staffing will provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to the applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, gender, genetic information, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by federal or state law. The company will provide reasonable accommodations to allow an applicant to participate in the hiring process if so requested.

If you have any questions about the job posting, please contact recruiting@acsprostaffing.com

If you have any questions about our Reasonable Accommodation Policy, please feel free to email hr@acsprostaffing.com

title: Senior Systems Engineer - Project Engineer - Technical Project Manager (onsite)
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Systems Engineer to join Sonatech, LLC in Santa Barbara California.

Sonatech, LLC is a premier undersea acoustics engineering and manufacturing company. With a focus on supplying advanced SONAR solutions for the US Navy, our technical expertise, customized design capabilities and diverse manufacturing abilities have led to Sonatech products being deployed on virtually every class of underwater Navy system currently in operation.

Located in beautiful Santa Barbara, CA five minutes from the beach, we pride ourselves as having a culture of innovation as well as first-class customer service. Sonatech has a challenging and rewarding work environment where employees can develop their careers by taking on new responsibilities and providing innovative solutions.

**Job Description**

This position is an opportunity to shape new products from scratch and improve existing ones. The candidate will work closely with customers to develop system concepts, technical requirements, and product specifications. Following, the candidate will lead the technical team throughout the development lifecycle.

**Responsibilities**

* Generation of technical requirement and specifications, requirement management, compliance traceability and verification
* Architecture development, interface definition, system modelling, algorithm development, data analysis, and trade studies
* Provide technical leadership throughout the development lifecycle
* Progress reporting to management and customer representatives
* Support to systems integration and customer trial activities

**Requirements**

* Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering
* Minimum 10 years working in a system engineering leadership role with direct product design and development experience
* Experience guiding products through the full development lifecycle and field trials
* Excellence cross-functional troubleshooting skills
* Excellent communications skills
* US Citizenship required and ability to obtain a DoD secret security clearance

**Preferred Skills**

* Experience with underwater acoustic positioning systems for tracking and navigation
* Understanding of underwater acoustic principles
* Understanding of electronic systems with embedded SW applications
* Experience in developing computer-based performance models in MATLAB to support system concept/design definition
* Strong oral and written communications skills including presenting to customers and senior leadership

**Benefits**

Benefits include medical, dental and vision, life insurance, paid vacation and sick time, 3% 401K contribution (no matching required), company events.

**Position Role Type**: Onsite - Teleworking not available for this position.

**Salary Range:** $150,000 - $220,000

Sonatech is an EEO/AA/Disability/Vets Employer.

  
  
***Job Posted by ApplicantPro***

title: Plumbing Project Manager
description:

Critchfield Mechanical, Inc. is seeking an experienced Project Manager with advanced knowledge in plumbing to join the team. You will be responsible to manage design build, plan spec and design assist project from bid to completion. The ideal candidate will have plumbing specific expertise and desire to work in a dynamic environment. title: Project Manager I - Electrical
description:
**Position Summary**

The Project Manager provides project estimating and sales support to our Electrical Testing and Field Services customers. This position is responsible for working directly with members of sales, engineering, and operations to provide technical and commercial sales support including identifying and qualifying leads, job costing/estimating, proposal generation, and post-order sales support.

**Responsibilities**

* Work collaboratively with inside and outside sales team.
* On occasion, perform job walks with sales staff at customer sites.
* Review customer RFPs, engineering drawings, and technical content.
* Reading and interpreting electrical specifications and drawings.
* Estimate work hours, required materials, travel, logistics, and other project needs to meet customer scope of work.
* Develop proposals and costing spreadsheets for jobs and projects.
* Develop and maintain a knowledge base library of reference materials for use in preparing proposals, presentations, and technical collateral.
* Handle cancellations or changes in sales order and communicate the changes with the related departments.
* Coordinate with production departments for status on orders to ensure the delivery commitment to clients is met.
* Generate accurate detailed reports on a timely basis; Monitor daily log of proposals and quotes to insure timely submissions.
* Conduct client communication in a highly customer service-oriented manner and potentially expand the scope of project work as well as negotiate any extra charges associated with work performed.
* Communicate with clients, management and their team for effective problem resolution and transfer of pertinent information.
* Accountable for maintaining status of projects and providing the client with this information.
* Help manage the on-going schedule and travel planning to facilitate timely response to customers.
* Work may require flexible hours, weekends, holidays and night work. Must be available for out-of-town work.
* All work and decisions shall be conducted in strict compliance of all regulatory law.
* Observe all safety rules and Best Practices; Follow all company policies and procedures.
* All work and decisions shall be conducted in strict compliance of all company and regulatory laws.
* Other duties as assigned by manager.

**Required Experience and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor degree in related field or experience equivalency and a minimum of 5 years related experience.
* Ability to read and understand complex blueprints, schematics, parts lists, and additional technical materials for troubleshooting circuit breakers and electrical power equipment. Field Service experience.
* Effectively communicate verbally and in writing with customers and peers. Must be able to read, write, and speak English fluently.
* Dependable and responsible with good judgment and organizational skills; able to multi-task with shifting priorities
* Good customer service, time management and follow-up skills.
* Self-management of assigned projects and job cost accountability to perform work within budgeted cost estimates.
* Able to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks.
* Able to work with various people throughout the organization-Customer Focused.
* Focus on accuracy and efficiencies.
* Strong computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and data entry; CRM experience a plus.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, and excellent telephone personality skills.
* Ability to properly construct written proposals.
* For positions that utilize a company vehicle, will be required to have a valid driver’s license.

title: Contract Technical Project Manager
description:
OverviewAs a Contract Technical Project Manager in our dynamic IT Strategy & Programs team, you'll play a crucial role in steering our most critical projects from conception to completion. You'll be the linchpin ensuring our projects are not only cost-effective and efficiently communicated but also meticulously planned and impeccably executed, with a keen eye on quality assurance, risk mitigation, and overall project viability. This role calls for a blend of strategic vision and practical project management, making it perfect for someone who thrives in managing complex, high-stakes initiatives.

Key Responsibilities* **Strategic Project Leadership:** Take charge of multifaceted initiatives, spanning several business domains, driving them towards success.
* **Team Motivation and Leadership:** Provide inspiring on-site leadership, fostering a motivated project team committed to achieving project objectives and milestones.
* **Lifecycle Management:** Own the project lifecycle, ensuring seamless progression from initiation through to deployment, encompassing both significant projects and a collection of smaller ones.
* **Executive Communication:** Master the art of high-level communication, effectively conveying project statuses to executive teams.
* **Best Practices Development:** Play a pivotal role in developing and refining project management methodologies, tools, and practices to elevate our organizational capabilities.
* **Operational Excellence:** Oversee daily project operations, aligning resources and efforts with the Strategic Planning team's goals and schedules.
* **Risk and Scope Management:** Proactively manage project scopes, identifying potential risks and devising contingency plans to ensure project integrity.

Ideal Qualifications* **Education:** A Bachelor’s degree in IT, Information Systems, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a closely related field is preferred.
* **Experience:** At least 5 years of relevant experience in Technical Project Management, with a minimum of 3 years involving senior leadership engagement. A background in financial services is a plus.
* **Certifications:** PMO, PMP, or Six Sigma certifications are highly regarded, as is experience with Agile methodologies.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Adept in Jira & Confluence, with strong skills in MS Project, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, and SharePoint. PowerBI knowledge is a bonus.

Skills and Abilities* **Leadership:** Capable of working independently with minimal oversight, displaying strong leadership and communication skills.
* **Problem-Solving:** Creative and analytical approach to problem-solving, with a knack for fostering teamwork and innovation.
* **Communication:** Exceptional listening and interpersonal skills, capable of building trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.
* **Organizational Prowess:** Demonstrated ability to prioritize, plan, and execute work and deliverables efficiently and effectively.
* **Agility:** Able to navigate ambiguity, work collaboratively across departments, and drive results under tight deadlines.

In this role, you'll not only manage projects but also mold the future of our IT strategies, making it an ideal position for someone passionate about making a tangible impact through meticulous project management and strategic foresight. If you're ready to lead, inspire, and deliver, we're looking forward to your application.  
  
#LI-MC1

title: Product Manager II, Job Seeker Profile
description:
We offer a hybrid work environment. Most US-based positions can alsobeperformed remotely (any exceptions will be noted in the Minimum Qualifications below.)

**Our Mission:** 

To actively connect people to their next great opportunity. 

**Who We Are:** 

ZipRecruiter is a leading online employment marketplace. Powered by AI-driven smart matching technology, the company actively connects millions of all-sized businesses and job seekers through innovative mobile, web, and email services, as well as through partnerships with the best job boards on the web. ZipRecruiter has the #1 rated job search app on iOS & Android. 

**Summary of Job:**

The Job Seeker Profile team aims to continuously understand a job seeker's experience, qualifications, and career objectives. ZipRecruiter's AI-driven matching technology leverages Profile data to connect employers and job seekers. As the Product Manager II of the Profile team, you will own and improve our understanding of our job seekers and their objectives. That includes data collection, processing, storage, and consumption by internal ML models and user-facing use cases. Clear communication and close partnership with cross-functional teams are crucial to succeed in this role.

**Key Focuses:**

* Become the domain expert in our job seeker data and the representation of their career objectives
* Build empathy for our job seekers by constantly using the product
* Write specs, manage project execution, and define product rollout strategy and communications
* Deliver product roadmap and write documentation for technical and non-technical audiences
* Work with Product, Engineering, Analytics, and ML teams to prioritize and launch improvements to the Job Seeker Profile data stack and to drive more connections between job seekers and employers
* Understand internal and external use cases designing interfaces that are easy to use, and ensuring the data product optimizes for business outcomes.
* Own profile features end-to-end, from design, to front-end implementation, to back-end data storage, to testing and monitoring.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* 3+ years of professional experience in product management
* Strong foundation in analytics, data technologies, and data principles
* Demonstrable track record in successful cross-functional collaboration skills; ability to create clarity and drive focus in complex and dynamic contexts
* Data-driven decision-making skills, with the ability to analyze and interpret data to extract meaningful insights
* Technical aptitude and attention to detail without losing sense of the bigger picture

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 1+ years of experience in data-related product roles
* 4+ years of professional experience in product management
* Successful experience operating and excelling in technical and cross-functional environments
* Experience owning a user experience from front end UI to back end data storage

**As part of our team, you'll enjoy:**

* Competitive salary
* Exceptional benefits package
* Flexible Vacation & Paid Time Off
* Employer-matched 401(k) plan

#LI-Remote

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $140,000 - $175,000. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location, and the range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location, role-related knowledge and skills, depth of experience, relevant education or training, and additional role-related considerations.

Depending on the position offered, equity, bonuses, commission, or other forms of compensation may also be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and other benefits.

title: Architectural Project Manager
description:
**Job Title: Project Manager**

**Industry:** Architecture

**Employment Type:** Full-time

**Pay Range:** $80,000 - $100,000 per year + Discretionary Bonus

 

**Role Responsibilities**

 

The Archictect / Project Manager is responsible for leading multiple K-12 projects, managing all phases of construction. Acting as primary client contact and collaborating with Managing Principal Architect. Developing project programs, scope, budgets, and schedules. Maintaining effective communication with team, clients, and consultants. This role offers a dynamic opportunity to make a significant impact on K-12 education projects.

 

**Responsibilities:**

· Full leadership responsibility for the management of multiple K-12 type projects of varying sizes and complexities

· Ability to develop and manage all phases from conceptual design through construction

· Act as the primary client contact in coordination with the Managing Principal Architect

· Develop project programs, scope, schedules and budgets

· Manage project teams throughout the entire contracts, design, approval and construction process and serve as the daily contact for the client

· Report regularly and directly to a managing principal architect

· Submit drawings to DSA for a successful intake and develop thoughtful and complete responses for DSA back check and approval

· Communicate with consultants, contractors, sub-consultants and other disciplines to resolve project details and technical issues and that comply with office standards

· Assign work to the project team, provide instruction, guidance and mentorship to team members

* Respond to Requests For Information (RFIs), including coordinating with consultants, clients, and construction team

· Track and follow-up on communication to team members, clients and consultants as needed

· General Office Duties as required as related to position

 

**Qualifications - Skills/Experience**

· 8+ years of k-12 experience through all phases of architectural projects

· Division of the State Architect plancheck experience preferred but not required

· Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Architecture preferred but not required

· Architectural license preferred but not required

· Proficiency in Revit, 2D CAD drawing, Bluebeam and Microsoft Word, Excel & Outlook

· Good knowledge of Bluebeam, SketchUp and relevant Adobe products preferred

· Self-Motivated / Self-Starter

· Ability to multitask and prioritize

· Needs to be extremely organized

· Detail oriented

· Good written and oral communication skills

· General computer proficiency with Windows operating systems

· A minimum of 40 hours per week required

· Compensation will be dependent on qualifications and licensure

 

**Benefits For Full-Time Employees**

· Discretionary Bonus Based on Several Factors

· Paid Vacation and Sick Time

· Paid Holidays

· Health Benefits Medical, Dental, Vision

· Life Insurance Benefits

· 401(k) Eligibility

· Clean, Air Conditioned, Friendly Working Environment

 

**Working conditions**

This job is in an office environment, with regular site visit/travel requirements and outdoor time.

 

**Physical Requirements**

· **Stationary Position** frequently remains stationary up to 90% of the time and sitting up to 8 hours in a day

· **Move/Traverse** infrequently bend, stand, stoop and/or walk

· **Carry Weight** infrequently carry weight and/or lift objects (light to heavy) weighing up to 25 pounds

· **Hearing and Speech** frequently communicates with the ability to hear and talk on a regular basis with employees, coworkers, and all personnel matters; must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations

· **Sight** frequent use of sight to detect images on computer, office documents, and office objects near and far

 

**Disclaimer**

 

All Applicants are subject to a background screening on a state and federal level. This job posting is subject to change at any time. Nothing in this job post is meant to guarantee an employment offer. This job description neither restricts nor prevents management’s right to assign and/or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time of the essential functions. It does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be subsequently assigned.

description:

· Cultivate client satisfaction and harmonize expectations with project outcomes.

title: System Validation Technical Project Manager
description:
**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* Expertise in Product development or Product validation cycle of consumer electronics product
* Responsible for coordinating team activities and taking the ownership of project execution
* Drive and execute validation to meet key deadlines and priority goals
* Clearly document test results. Keep track of bugs encountered and fixed
* Support system bring up and debug activities
* Clearly communicate test plans and results
* Should be experienced in leading team, delegating work, monitoring work progress, KPI tracking and Status Reporting to customer
* Candidate should have good presentation skills and be able to provide executive level status reporting as well as proficiency in using online project tracking tools.
* Should be ready to extend the responsibility in Hiring Process, Team Building, Careers & Training Development, Knowledge Management, Team Mentoring

**Required Skills (Technical Competency):**

* Highly skilled in embedded testing - Automation scripting and Manual testing.
* Working knowledge of Android CE devices
1. Should have testing expertise with peripheral devices like Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Camera, Audio, Sensors etc and related testing tools
2. Should be familiarized with core embedded system concepts like MCU, SoC, Memory etc
3. Should have knowledge of android tools and commands

* Expertise with Python and should be capable of doing shell/ batch scripting as required. Nice to have: C, Java.
1. Working expertise with Python libraries like pandas, numpy, opencv etc. Should be able to find and use new libraries as required.

* Should have knowledge of test automation frameworks and work experience in Android and iOS apps automation with Appium
* Should be capable to work on both MAC and Windows operating systems
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Should be able to communicate effectively and positively

title: Architectural Project Manager
description:
**Competitive Pay + Excellent Benefits + Collaborative Environment! Innovative Firm!**  
  
This Jobot Job is hosted by: Luke Hoyt  
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" buttonand sending us your resume.  
Salary: $100,000 - $120,000 per year  
  
**A bit about us:**

  
  
A full-service commercial interior architecture, planning and design firm with over 40 years of experience in Southern California. The firm is seeking a motivated and experienced Project Manager specializing in commercial tenant improvement projects. Our projects include commercial office, industrial/logistics, manufacturing, retail, medical and dental. Our clients include developers, landlords, property managers, owners, general contractors and trade partners.  
  
**Why join us?**

  
  
We invest in growth of our team members to advance in their careers.  
We are focused on developing and expanding practice areas and encouraging excellence.  
We sponsor certification for NCIDQ, IDEX California®, LEED and WELL exams.  
We offer a professional environment that is positive, collaborative, fast-paced, and friendly.  
We are located in Central Irvine, near the Irvine Spectrum, with easy freeway access.  
We participate in lunch and learn presentations, and employee appreciation lunches.  
We offer a very competitive compensation structure with an excellent benefits package (including medical, dental, vision, retirement plan and additional benefits).  
Additional benefits and perks include: pet insurance, health and wellness reimbursements, professional programs and continuing education reimbursements.  
  
**Job Details**

  
  
Project Management:   
  
Lead, manage and oversee all aspects of the design process throughout all phases from initial design to the completion of construction.   
Collaborate effectively with internal team members (which may include Technical Director and Production team) to achieve a successful project outcome.   
Work closely and communicate the goals and objectives of each project with consultants, vendors and contractors.   
Manage the entire project team to ensure that client specifications and expectations are fulfilled.   
Help prepare project proposals, schedules, negotiate contracts and fees, coordinate bidding process.   
Ensure projects are meeting key milestones and stay within budget.   
  
Client Relations:   
  
Cultivate long-term client relationships through exceptional service; providing clients with personalized attention, clear and excellent verbal and written communication, responsiveness and knowledge sharing.   
Build partnerships with new clients and industry partners to grow client base.   
Represent us in a professional manner – working with a variety of consultants, vendors, engineers, general contractors, landlords, property managers and property owners.   
Leadership and Management:  
  
Mentor and support growth of team members.   
Contribute to recruitment of new talent for the office.   
Continue with professional development (continuing education, attending seminars, stay up-to-date on codes and trends, licensing and certifications, participate in professional industry associations).  
Maintain high professional standards at all times (communication, courtesy, service, appearance, business etiquette).   
Skills and Qualifications  
  
Minimum 8-10 years of relevant Architectural or interior design experience  
Strong leadership and business acumen, as well as the ability to manage people effectively  
Has the proven ability to self-manage under pressure and handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment  
Must communicate clearly and effectively (both verbal and written)  
Solid critical-thinking skills with the willingness and ability to make decisions  
Technical, detail and constructability skills  
Must be detail-oriented, highly organized, and work well with a variety of staff  
Demonstrate experience working on all phases of a project  
Attain the firm’s goals relative to design, technical and management excellence  
Required to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines  
Able to work independently as well as interact with the team  
Degree in Interior Design, Interior Architecture or Architecture  
Excellent working knowledge of AutoCAD 22 or above, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook  
Knowledgeable of 2022 CBC and Accessibility Code Compliance  
Should be capable of completing a basic accessibility survey  
Working knowledge of reviewing a full set of construction documents  
Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the profession  
Architectural License or CID Certification preferred  
Positive attitude, strong work ethic  
Strong business development skills a plus  
Be a U.S. citizen, or already possess a work visa for working in the U.S.  
  
Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Office Manager
description:
**WHY 3D TECHNICAL SERVICES?**

3D Technical Services was formed in 1998 from a group of experienced personnel in the Instrument and Control industry. This group of Project Managers, Instrument Technicians, Fitters, and Electricians developed a reputation for quality work throughout the Bay Area.

Our goal is to provide our customers with a superior source of quality instrument and automation services by utilizing our extensive experience and knowledge. We pledge to conduct our business by treating all customers, employees, suppliers, and the community with honesty, fairness, respect, and integrity. We support our local community and youth organizations to help promote the generation of tomorrow.

 

**YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY:**

The Office Manager role is responsible for providing administrative support to the executive team and/or specific departments as assigned. This position will provide general assistance to all levels of staff.

 

**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**

* Act as liaison between executive staff and others (i.e., internal employees, external vendors, suppliers, clients, etc.) in an organized, prompt and professional manner, and serves as a central clearing position for general information.
* Oversee/process day-to-day administrative items: payroll, timesheets, union pension & benefit paperwork filing, invoice management, payroll taxes, supplier communications, expense reports, etc.
* Performs filing, typing, data input and other clerical support to all other departments and personnel, as directed.
* Answer external inquiries and directs calls to appropriate staff, and takes messages, as necessary.
* *The duties and responsibilities are intended to describe the general nature and scope of work being performed by this position. This is not a complete listing and other duties will be assigned based on the position’s role within the business unit.*

 

**WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:**

* Knowledge of payroll taxes- perform weekly payments to FTB and IRS, submit quarterly and yearly payroll reports.
* Computer, filing, attention to detail and strong analytical skills are necessary
* Proficient in using a computer and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, etc.), and QuickBooks Pro
* Prioritize and proactively manage multiple tasks, changing priorities as necessary
* Self-motivated, proactive and an effective team player with efficient oral and written communication skills
* Interact effectively and professionally with all levels of employees, both management and staff alike, vendors, clients, and others

 

**WHAT YOU BRING TO US:**

* Associate degree in Business Administration or related discipline or equivalent experience.
* Minimum 2 years’ experience in office administrative work and bring a wide skill set including: time management, organization, and project management skills
* Proficient technical skills including: Detailed knowledge of QuickBooks Pro, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)

 

**BENEFITS:** 

* $30- $39.50 salary range based on experience
* 10 days PTO per year plus 9 paid holidays
* Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance

Employment Type

Full-time

title: Bilingual Sr. Technical Project Manager
description:
**Sr. Technical Project Manager (Bilingual in English/Mandarin)**  
99 Ranch Market is the largest Asian supermarket chain in the United States, with over 60 store locations and more coming. While we continue to expand, we aim to provide the best Omni channel shopping experience. As the company's newest and fastest-growing team, the e-commerce squad works like a startup. We not only fulfill the company’s motto, “For 100, We Try Harder.” — We “Outthink the Rest 99%, Be That 1% of Dreamers.” We value ownership, diversity, forward-thinking, creativity, and transparency in every aspect of the work we do. If you would like to challenge yourself and still want to have fun at work, you are looking at the right place. We would like to have YOU join us and create a playful culture together!  
  
**Position Summary:**We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Technical Project Manager to join our company. As a Technical Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing various software and/or hardware projects within the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and stakeholders, to ensure successful project delivery.  
  
**Responsibilities:*** Manage the planning, execution, and delivery of software and/or hardware projects, ensuring they are completed within scope, timeline, and budget
* Define project objectives, requirements, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders and product managers
* Develop and maintain project plans, including task schedules, resource allocation, and risk management strategies
* Coordinate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth project workflow and alignment of project goals
* Identify and manage project dependencies, risks, and issues, implementing appropriate mitigation strategies
* Track project progress, provide regular status updates, and report on key metrics to stakeholders
* Participate in discovery calls to understand requirements and road maps
* Utilize project management tools, such as Jira and Confluence, to track tasks, document project details, and manage project artifacts

**Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred)
* 5 + years of experience as a Technical Project Manager in one of the following areas (Retail, Warehouse, Supply chain or E- Commerce).
* Strong knowledge of platforms, technologies, and systems
* Excellent project management skills, with a track record of successfully delivering complex technical projects on time and within budget
* Proficiency in project management methodologies, tools, and techniques
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate and influence stakeholders at all levels
* Problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a strategic and analytical mindset
* Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and work in a fast-paced environment
* Experience with project management tools, such as Jira and Confluence, for task tracking and documentation
* Experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus
* Experience with using communication tools such as Slack, Zoom, and Google Meet
* Experience in large-scale software development life cycle
* Bilingual proficiency in English/Mandarin
* Experience in Korber, WMS, E-Commerce, Toshiba, SAP, SOP, ERP, CRM. Project full cycle management, business sense and understanding, project management certificate (PMP, CISSP), AI, LLM (large language model), machine learning.

  
**Employment type:** Full Time, M-F 9:00am to 5:30pm  
  
**Location:** 6338 Regio Ave., Buena Park, CA 90620  
  
**Salary:** The rate of pay is between $120K - $160K per hour. This is general guideline only and not guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) the responsibilities of the job, your education, skills, qualifications, experience and location.  
  
**Benefits:*** Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Life and AD&D Insurance with other optional plans
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with 4% Company Match
* Paid Time Off
* Long-Term Service Award
* Employee Referral Program
* Employee Discount
* Benefit Hub - enjoy discounts, rewards, and perks on thousands of brands in a variety of categories: Travel, Auto, Electronics, Apparel, Local Deals, Education, Entertainment, Restaurants, Health and Wellness, Beauty and Spa, Tickets, Sports, and Outdoors

  
**Privacy Policy:**By submitting your information, you acknowledge that you have read our privacy policy linked below and consent to receive communications from us:  
  
**Disclaimer:**Tawa Group dba 99 Ranch Market, is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Electrical Project Manager
description:
**Desired Skills:**

* Clean appearance
* Clean DMV record

Outlook


Word


Excel


Blubeam or Adobe


Autocad


Revit


Electrical Estimating Software


Integrated Accounting Software

* NEC familiarity
* Motor controls and process systems knowledge
* Knowledge of 600V and below service entrance and distribution
* Medium voltage systems knowledge is a plus
* Knowledge of combustion engine power generation
* Knowledge of photovoltaic power generation systems
* Understanding of HVAC and refrigeration systems operation
* Understanding of liquid pumping and transfer systems
* Understanding of hydraulic and mechanical systems
* Knowledge of classified location installation methods (hazardous locations)
* Mechanical skills and knowledgeable tool usage is a plus

**Education:**

* Bachelors' degree in Construction Management, Construction Engineering, or equivalent experience in a related field

**Experience:**

* 3-5 years of experience in Construction Project Management and or Electrical Estimating, or equivalent experience in a related field

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Establishing viable project pursuits for engineered or design build projects
* Meeting with facility owners and or general contractors to develop project scope for design build projects
* Establishing project proposal and pertinent documents
* Assuming overall responsibility for a profitable, well-constructed, safe project, completed in a timely manner
* Determining the most cost effective construction methods and use of personnel, material, equipment and subcontractors
* Reviewing and approving subcontractor selections and invoicing
* Establishing field labor needs for managed projects
* Fulfilling all commitments or revising commitments when circumstances change significantly and previous commitments cannot be met
* Advising key stakeholders of unavoidable delays
* Supporting and assuming responsibility for decisions made
* Taking initiative and doing what it takes to achieve goals
* Paying close attention to the specifics and details of every aspect of the project or work assignment
* Noticing variances from the scope of the project and taking appropriate action to resolve discrepancies
* Checking and editing work or getting peer review to ensure accuracy
* Clearly conveying important information to all relevant parties in order to ensure the goals and modifications are clearly established and understood
* Coordinating and providing direction for the budget estimating, purchasing, engineering, accounting, cost and construction functions as they relate to the completion of the project
* Negotiating, preparing, issuing and executing change orders (proposals) and providing that information to field crew, subcontractors and other necessary parties, and preparing revisions to the original budget as a result of changes and revisions to work.
* Being able to maintain poise and professionalism under stressful or challenging situations
* Communicating in a succinct, logical, and clear manner
* Presenting recommendations and supporting conclusions with facts in order to gain the confidence of the listener
* Initiating, establishing and maintaining positive working relationships with co-workers, customers, suppliers, and subcontractors in order to facilitate construction activities, represent the organization in a professional manner and gain repeat business and customer referrals.
* Organizing, conducting and representing the company at project coordination meetings as needed
* Promoting teamwork
* Using an understanding of the audience to address different groups in the most appropriate and effective way.
* Demonstrating an understanding of technical and professional aspects of the job
* Making use of applicable technical manuals and other resources
* Seeking to improve knowledge level and remain current as to technical procedures
* Applying job knowledge at expected level of competence and maintaining thorough understanding of the project
* Staying current on technical / professional developments

**Physical Demands:** 

* Work Environment - Jobsite and office environment
* While performing the duties of this job a project manager may be regularly required to- drive to and from the jobsite, sit, talk and/or hear both in person and over the phone.
* While performing the duties of this job a project manager may required to frequently inspect the project and may be exposed to normal hazards associated with construction and various weather conditions.

Applicants should send an electronic resume to office at dahlelectric dot com or reply to this ad.

The above listed skills and desired requirements should be viewed as a guideline and not a comprehensive checklist for your employment. We encourage all applicants, regardless of background, with an interest in project management to send us a resume, thank you.  
  
Salary- DOE, see anticipated compensation range  
Benefits- medical/ dental/ vision for employee  
Retirement- 401K plan with employer 4% match  
Other- paid vacation & holidays

title: Project Manager (Audio Visual) - Honolulu, HI
description:
Welcome to Ford AV, where cutting-edge integration of audio, video, lighting, music, and technical aptitude forms the cornerstone of extraordinary experiences. If you're a tech-savvy individual deeply immersed in the intricacies of AV technology, we extend a warm invitation to join us on an exciting journey. This opportunity isn't just a job posting; it's a compelling call to channel your technical skills and creativity onto a platform where innovation and passion harmonize seamlessly. Join our team today and become a catalyst for next-generation advancements in the audio video world!

**Why Ford AV?**

Ford AV is America’s leading audiovisual solutions integrator. With over 50 years of experience, we are the complete technology provider for the nation’s top enterprise brands for design, installation, and service of professional sound systems, AV systems, video conferencing systems, networks, and security surveillance systems. Ford strives for excellence in all aspects of our work and brand including offering competitive compensation, benefits, and perks for our team members.

* Career Growth Opportunities
* Continued Education Opportunities
* Medical Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Short-term Disability
* Life Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* 401K w/company matching
* Employee Referral Bonus Program

Entry-level and senior-level positions are available. Entry-level positions will be coached and challenged through an extensive training and development period. The Project Manager is responsible for the execution of their assigned jobs, spanning from job initiation through job closeout, overseeing installation, engineering, and training. Jobs must be completed safely, to specifications, within budget, on time, and to the satisfaction of the customer. The Project Manager champions Ford safety programs with special emphasis on vehicle and job site safety for the team members they manage. They are responsible for mentoring Job Superintendents, Installation Technicians, and Engineers, and should provide leadership throughout the Ford Job Center team. The Ford Project Manager also provides estimation review with sales personnel during pre-sale work of projects.

**Qualifications**:

* Degree in Construction, Engineering, Leadership, Management, or equivalent experience preferred
* Proficiency in leadership, communication (oral and written), computers (Outlook, Excel), time-management, and problem solving
* Personal interest in audio, video, lighting systems, and/or construction
* Safety & OSHA certification awareness
* Ability to travel up to 65% of the time while in training (amount will vary based on experience and specific competency)
* Experience with scheduling software preferred
* Certifications: PMP, CTS preferred (for Senior-level position)
* Prior supervisory/management experience (for Senior-level position)
* Construction, Installation, engineering or management background preferred (for Senior-level position)

**To Apply: S**ubmit an application at www.fordav.com/careers

**Compensation**:  
Ford offers on-going industry training, competitive pay and benefits including medical, dental, vision, short-term disability and life insurance, travel Per Diem, paid time off (PTO), paid holidays, 401K with matching, industry certifications and opportunities for advancement.

**Key Words**:

*AV, A/V, Audio Video, Audio-Video, Audiovisual, Audio Visual, Videoconferencing, Telepresence, Digital Signage, Sound Systems, Audio Systems, Audio Design, Video Systems, Video Design, Video Production, Audio Production, Audio Video Contractor, Audio Engineering, Unified Communications, Broadcast, Control Systems, Digital Culture, Technical Theater, Digital Design, Lighting Design, Communication Systems, Sound Engineer, A/V Integration, A/V Integrator, Sound Engineer, Electronic Installation, Commercial Construction, Telecommunications, Interactive Media, CTS Certification, Infocomm, Avixa*

title: Project Manager
description:

The ideal candidate should have 7+ years of experience in K-12 DSA educational construction and/or public works, with experience in creating and managing each project and their individual budgets, schedules, project priority list, bid documents, front end documents, district standards, design specifications, etc. This position will require knowledge in preconstruction services, planning, contractor procurement (public works contracting code), construction management, and DSA/local project closeout.

* 7+ years of experience in the design and construction of K-12 school projects.

* Communicate and coordinate with contractors
* Maintain the highest standards of workmanship that adhere to original plans and specifications
* Understand and execute construction plans and scope of work
* Manage multiple construction projects simultaneously by providing technical guidance for field personnel
* Experience with irrigation systems, hardscape installation, horticulture knowledge including plant material and landscape material
* Expert time management and communication skills. Spanish speaking is huge plus

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in construction management or other related fields, preferably 3 years
* Familiarity with construction management software
* Strong leadership qualities
* Strong negotiation skills
* Deadline and detail-oriented
* Excellent communication skills
* Bilingual Spanish preferred but not required

**Perks and Pluses:**

* Medical, Dental, Vision
* Company paid vehicle, cell phone, laptop
* 1 week's paid vacation & sick leave
* Fast-paced working environment with a great work-life balance

title: Senior Project Manager (7283)
description:
**Overview:**  
ACS Professional Staffing is looking for an employee to work on-site with our client. The Senior Project Manager position manages project activities for refueling outages, forced outages, and on-line work as assigned, providing oversight of the staff involved in planning, leading, controlling, and monitoring to ensure that work is implemented safely, with quality, on-schedule, and within budget. **This full-time position is located in Richland, WA.**

**Pay range:** **$58.90 – $102.39**

**Benefits:**

* Sick Leave: One hour of paid sick leave for every 40-hours worked (sick leave can be used after 90-days of employment)
* EAP: Employee Assistance Program
* Benefit Options: Medical, HSA, Group Life/AD&D, Voluntary Life/AD&D, Voluntary Short-Term Disability, Voluntary Long-Term Disability, Voluntary Critical Illness, Voluntary Accident, 401k (eligible after one year and 1,000 hours worked - employer match up to 4%)
* Other benefits include the following: Calm App, Access Perks

**Responsibilities:**

* Develops the budgets, including tracking cost versus budget for assigned projects. Assures proper progress and focus through frequent interface with the client, engineers, related parties, and management.
* Develop and manage contracts and interface with vendors.
* Develops project schedules commensurate with project complexity and size to be able to manage risk, accurately track progress, enforce accountability, and manage critical paths and float.
* Mentors other less experienced project managers.
* Prepare and deliver written and oral communications to various groups including senior management.
* Develop and maintain long-range plan strategies associated with assigned projects.
* Support the effective implementation of the Columbia Generating Station Self-Assessment and Corrective Action Program.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, construction management, project management, business, or related field from an accredited college or university and twenty years of experience in a technical field.
* OR an AA/AS degree in engineering, construction management, project management, business, or a related field from an accredited college or university and twenty-two years of experience in a technical field.
* OR a High School Diploma or GED and twenty-four years of experience in a technical field.
* An advanced degree in a related field of study or business may be accepted in lieu of two years of experience.
* RO/SRO License or CGS Management Certification is required.
* Project Management certification is required.
* Extensive work experience in the role of direct supervisor or project manager in the commercial nuclear industry environment focused on maintenance, operations, engineering, or construction.
* Nuclear plant operator production coordination experience, work management experience in conducting and coordinating plant production work.
* Managing complex projects, online work management, or refueling and forced outage-related activities.
* Advanced project management techniques at Commercial Nuclear Power Plants or similar facilities.

Work sponsorship is not available at this time. Third-party candidates will not be considered for this position.

Because we are a federal government contractor, we have special restrictions placed on us for hiring foreign nationals into certain key positions within the company. This particular position requires U.S. citizenship.

ACS Professional Staffing will provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to the applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, gender, genetic information, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by federal or state law. The company will provide reasonable accommodations to allow an applicant to participate in the hiring process if so requested.

If you have any questions about the job posting, please contact recruiting@acsprostaffing.com

If you have any questions about our Reasonable Accommodation Policy, please feel free to email hr@acsprostaffing.com
